textbox.title: Table Window Initial Life To Date

helpgrid.innerhtml: Use the slider control below the graph to change the start and end measures and to zoom in. Drag the graph to scroll.
Use the slider control below the graph to change the start and end measures and to zoom in. Drag the graph to scroll.

table.label: Characteristic Action Values for Measurement Point

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can filter to view only the relationships where the current asset is the source or the target. You also can view all relationships.
Use the slider control below the graph to change the start and end measures and to zoom in. Drag the graph to scroll.
View Work Orders and Tickets that are open for this asset. Additional details are available in Work Details.
Use the slider control below the graph to change the start and end measures and to zoom in. Drag the graph to scroll.

To generate asset numbers for the whole hierarchy in the Item Assembly Structure, click Autonumber All. Alternatively, enter the asset numbers for the first level in the hierarchy in the Asset Hierarchy table. To move to the second level in the hierarchy, click the detail button next to the Item field in the table and select Move To.
Use this action if you have reset the meter or replaced it with a different physical meter.

To change the asset's current status from UP to DOWN or DOWN to UP, select Change Status. To record the start and end of the asset's downtime, which leaves the asset in its current status, select Report Downtime.
Click New Row to add an asset. Edit the New Sequence column to reorder the sequence. Click Save to save changes without exiting. Click OK to exit.
To refine your search, enter the criteria for the column(s) and Click on Find.

section.description: Use the fields listed below to update current licenses in the set.
section.label: Mass Update

table.label: Meter Durations for Item Under Warranty

helpgrid.innerhtml: To find Workorders during a specific date range, enter the dates in the Date From: and Date To: fields. To refine your search, enter filter criteria for the column(s) and press Enter or click the icon.

To find Spot Check during a specific date range, enter the dates in the Date From: and Date To: fields. To refine your search, enter filter criteria for the column(s) and press Enter or click the icon.
To find Data Sheets during a specific date range, enter dates in the Date From: and Date To: fields. To refine your search, enter filter criteria for the column(s) and press Enter or click the icon.
To specify the data sheet you want to attach, type the necessary data for each sheet. To refine your list, enter filter criteria for the column(s) and press Enter or click search.
Specify the items that you want to include in the summary view for the asset in the Topology viewer. You can also configure the order in which these items appear.

Specify any asset specifications that you want to include in the summary view for the asset in the Topology viewer. Asset specifications provide additional classifications for assets and are configured in the Specifications tab.

Indicate the period for which assets are unavailable for maintenance. All assets of the selected type will have the same operational schedule. Overrides for individual assets can be entered in the Manage Asset Operational Schedule window.

Indicate the period for which an asset is unavailable for maintenance. You can add, change, or delete operational periods. The changes that you make here apply to individual assets and override the periods defined in the Define Asset Operational Schedule window.

Indicate the period during which maintenance can be done on assets. All assets of the selected type will have the same maintenance schedule. Overrides for individual assets can be entered in the Manage Asset Maintenance Schedule window.

Indicate the period during which maintenance can be done on an asset. You can add, change, or delete maintenance periods. The changes that you make here apply to individual assets and override the periods defined in the Define Asset Maintenance Schedule window.
Select a work zone to associate with the selected assets. Only assets that are in the same organization as the work zone that you choose will be updated.
To display the crew assignments for this asset record during a specific date range, select a start date and an end date.
Specify items for the positions. Information that you specify here does not create inventory issues.
